2 Line - UPDATED Weeknight Planned Service Change

The following planned service change is now ADDED: 11:45 PM Mon to 5 AM Tue, Nov 28 - 29 No 2 service between Chambers St and Atlantic Av-Barclays Ctr - take the 4/A/N or Q instead. 2 service operates in two sections: 1. Between 241 St and Chambers St, and via the 1 to/from Rector St. 2. Between Atlantic Av-Barclays Ctr and Flatbush Av. For service between Manhattan and Brooklyn, take the 4/N or Q. To/from Park Pl and Fulton St, use the 4 or A. To/from Wall St, use nearby Wall St 4 station. To/from Clark St, Borough Hall, Hoyt St, and Nevins St, use the 4 or A at nearby stations. Transfer between the 2 and A/N*/Q trains at Times Sq-42 St/Port Authority. Transfer between the 2/4 and N/Q/R trains at Atlantic Av-Barclays Ctr. Out-of-system transfer is available between Rector St 1/2 and Wall St or Bowling Green 4 stations. *N trains are rerouted via the Q in both directions between DeKalb Av and Canal St during this time. This service change affects one or more ADA accessible stations. Please call 511 for help with planning your trip. If you are deaf or hard of hearing, use your preferred relay service provider or the free 711 relay. For more information, click on the mta.info link in this email and read station signs.

Off Peak Fares in Effect thru Sunday

Saturday & Sunday, Nov. 26 & 27, off-peak fares are in effect - including the Railroad's Family Fare discounted ticket. That means kids ages 5-11 (limit of 4 children) can ride one-way for $1 when accompanied by a fare paying parent or guardian. Weekly and monthly ticket holders pay just for the kids and, as always, children under 5 ride free.
Purchase Round-Trip LIRR Tickets and Metro/Cards in Advance

Save time and money when traveling during the Thanksgiving holiday weekend: Buy roundtrip LIRR tickets and MetroCards before boarding at LIRR Ticket Machines or Ticket Windows, or via the new MTA eTix app. The LIRR wishes you a Happy Thanksgiving.

West of Hudson Thanksgiving Holiday Service (November 23 - 27)

On Thanksgiving Day, Thursday, November 24 a regular holiday/weekend schedule will be in effect for both lines. For those heading in to the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade, there will be a 6:22 AM departure from Port Jervis arriving in Hoboken at 8:30 AM (a connection at Secaucus Junction arrives at Penn Station-NY at 8:39 AM) and to get home, there's a 12:21 PM departure from Hoboken (12:14 PM from Penn Station-NY) that operates express to Suffern, then makes all stops to Port Jervis. On Friday, November 25 a regular weekday schedule will be in effect. On Saturday and Sunday, November 26 and 27, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect on both lines. See full service details at http://bit.ly/2f8ZVGu

Metro North's convenient Thanksgiving holiday service includes a special Thanksgiving Holiday Timetable covering Thursday, November 24 through Sunday, November 27. Be sure to pick one up in Grand Central or at our outlying stations. Or see our schedules page http://bit.ly/1arccwk or use the Train Time App http://bit.ly/1s3fjbQ . On Wednesday, November 23, take flight on one of our early getaway trains, which begin departing Grand Central at around 1 PM. See a regular timetable for details. Because of reduced ridership, some evening trains may be cancelled or combined. On Thanksgiving (Thursday, November 24), we will operate a modified weekend schedule with additional inbound trains for those of you heading to the Macy's Thanksgiving Holiday Parade. If you're leaving New York after the parade, you must have your ticket before boarding your train at Grand Central or Harlem-125th Street Station. We recommend you use MTA eTtix, the mobile ticketing app that enables you to purchase one way, round trip, ten trip, weekly and monthly passes on your smartphone or mobile device. See http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo On the Day after Thanksgiving (Friday, November 25), we will operate a Saturday schedule with additional trains inbound in the AM and outbound in the PM Finally, on Saturday, November 26 and Sunday, November 27 we will provide regular weekend schedules with additional Shoppers' Specials trains. See full service details at http://bit.ly/2g7vLZr

West of Hudson Thanksgiving Holiday Service (November 23 - 27)

On Thanksgiving Day, Thursday, November 24 a regular holiday/weekend schedule will be in effect for both lines. For those heading in to the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade, there will be a 6:22 AM departure from Port Jervis arriving in Hoboken at 8:30 AM (a connection at Secaucus Junction arrives at Penn Station-NY at 8:39 AM) and to get home, there's a 12:21 PM departure from Hoboken (12:14 PM from Penn Station-NY) that operates express to Suffern, then makes all stops to Port Jervis. On Friday, November 25 a regular weekday schedule will be in effect. On Saturday and Sunday, November 26 and 27, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect on both lines. See full service details at http://bit.ly/2f8ZVGu

Metro North's convenient Thanksgiving holiday service includes a special Thanksgiving Holiday Timetable covering Thursday, November 24 through Sunday, November 27. Be sure to pick one up in Grand Central or at our outlying stations. Or see our schedules page http://bit.ly/1arccwk or use the Train Time App http://bit.ly/1s3fjbQ . On Wednesday, November 23, take flight on one of our early getaway trains, which begin departing Grand Central at around 1 PM. See a regular timetable for details. Because of reduced ridership, some evening trains may be cancelled or combined. On Thanksgiving (Thursday, November 24), we will operate a modified weekend schedule with additional inbound trains for those of you heading to the Macy's Thanksgiving Holiday Parade. If you're leaving New York after the parade, you must have your ticket before boarding your train at Grand Central or Harlem-125th Street Station. We recommend you use MTA eTtix, the mobile ticketing app that enables you to purchase one way, round trip, ten trip, weekly and monthly passes on your smartphone or mobile device. See http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo On the Day after Thanksgiving (Friday, November 25), we will operate a Saturday schedule with additional trains inbound in the AM and outbound in the PM Finally, on Saturday, November 26 and Sunday, November 27 we will provide regular weekend schedules with additional Shoppers' Specials trains. See full service details at http://bit.ly/2g7vLZr

Off Peak Fares in Effect Thursday thru Sunday

Starting today thru Sunday, Nov. 27, off-peak fares are in effect - including the Railroad's Family Fare discounted ticket. That means kids ages 5-11 (limit of 4 children) can ride one-way for $1 when accompanied by a fare paying parent or guardian. Weekly and monthly ticket holders pay just for the kids and, as always, children under 5 ride free.
Temporary Closure of 34th St. Entrance Nov. 24 During Thanksgiving Day Parade

The NYPD has designated 34th Street a frozen zone during the morning of November 24 due to the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. As a result, the Long Island Rail Road's 34th Street entrance in Penn Station, and the elevator to 34th Street, is temporarily closed from 6:00 AM until the conclusion of the Parade. During this time, customers are advised to use the entrance at 7th Avenue and West 32nd Street.

Temporary Closure of 34th St. Entrance Nov. 24 During Thanksgiving Day Parade

Use MTA eTix \While Traveling This Holiday Season

MTA eTix is the free mobile ticketing app that lets you purchase Metro-North Railroad tickets directly on your smartphone or mobile device. You can purchase One-Way, Round- Trip, Ten-Trip, Weekly, and Monthly tickets, along with Reduced-Fare, Child and Family Fare tickets MTA eTix accepts Visa, MasterCard, Discover, and American Express cards. As well as Apple Pay and MasterPass. Avoid long lines, have a happier holiday! See full details at http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo
West of Hudson Thanksgiving Holiday Service (November 23 - 27)

Early getaway trains will operate on both the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley lines on Wednesday, November 23. See a current timetable for details or visit www.njtransit.com On Thanksgiving Day, Thursday, November 24 a regular holiday/weekend schedule will be in effect for both lines. For those heading in to the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade, there will be a 6:22 AM departure from Port Jervis arriving in Hoboken at 8:30 AM (a connection at Secaucus Junction arrives at Penn Station-NY at 8:39 AM) and to get home, there's a 12:21 PM departure from Hoboken (12:14 PM from Penn Station-NY) that operates express to Suffern, then makes all stops to Port Jervis. On Friday, November 25 a regular weekday schedule will be in effect. On Saturday and Sunday, November 26 and 27, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect on both lines. See full service details at http://bit.ly/2f8ZVGu

Metro North's convenient Thanksgiving holiday service includes a special Thanksgiving Holiday Timetable covering Thursday, November 24 through Sunday, November 27. Be sure to pick one up in Grand Central or at our outlying stations. Or see our schedules page http://bit.ly/1arccwk or use the Train Time App http://bit.ly/1s3fjbQ . On Wednesday, November 23, take flight on one of our early getaway trains, which begin departing Grand Central at around 1 PM. See a regular timetable for details. Because of reduced ridership, some evening trains may be cancelled or combined. On Thanksgiving (Thursday, November 24), we will operate a modified weekend schedule with additional inbound trains for those of you heading to the Macy's Thanksgiving Holiday Parade. If you're leaving New York after the parade, you must have your ticket before boarding your train at Grand Central or Harlem-125th Street Station. We recommend you use MTA eTtix, the mobile ticketing app that enables you to purchase one way, round trip, ten trip, weekly and monthly passes on your smartphone or mobile device. See http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo On the Day after Thanksgiving (Friday, November 25), we will operate a Saturday schedule with additional trains inbound in the AM and outbound in the PM Finally, on Saturday, November 26 and Sunday, November 27 we will provide regular weekend schedules with additional Shoppers' Specials trains. See full service details at http://bit.ly/2g7vLZr

Metro North's convenient Thanksgiving holiday service includes a special Thanksgiving Holiday Timetable covering Thursday, November 24 through Sunday, November 27. Be sure to pick one up in Grand Central or at our outlying stations. Or see our schedules page http://bit.ly/1arccwk or use the Train Time App http://bit.ly/1s3fjbQ . On Wednesday, November 23, take flight on one of our early getaway trains, which begin departing Grand Central at around 1 PM. See a regular timetable for details. Because of reduced ridership, some evening trains may be cancelled or combined. On Thanksgiving (Thursday, November 24), we will operate a modified weekend schedule with additional inbound trains for those of you heading to the Macy's Thanksgiving Holiday Parade. If you're leaving New York after the parade, you must have your ticket before boarding your train at Grand Central or Harlem-125th Street Station. We recommend you use MTA eTtix, the mobile ticketing app that enables you to purchase one way, round trip, ten trip, weekly and monthly passes on your smartphone or mobile device. See http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo On the Day after Thanksgiving (Friday, November 25), we will operate a Saturday schedule with additional trains inbound in the AM and outbound in the PM Finally, on Saturday, November 26 and Sunday, November 27 we will provide regular weekend schedules with additional Shoppers' Specials trains. See full service details at http://bit.ly/2g7vLZr
West of Hudson Thanksgiving Holiday Service (November 23 - 27)

Early getaway trains will operate on both the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley lines on Wednesday, November 23. See a current timetable for details or visit www.njtransit.com On Thanksgiving Day, Thursday, November 24 a regular holiday/weekend schedule will be in effect for both lines. For those heading in to the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade, there will be a 6:22 AM departure from Port Jervis arriving in Hoboken at 8:30 AM (a connection at Secaucus Junction arrives at Penn Station-NY at 8:39 AM) and to get home, there's a 12:21 PM departure from Hoboken (12:14 PM from Penn Station-NY) that operates express to Suffern, then makes all stops to Port Jervis. On Friday, November 25 a regular weekday schedule will be in effect. On Saturday and Sunday, November 26 and 27, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect on both lines. See full service details at http://bit.ly/2f8ZVGu
Use MTA eTix \While Traveling This Holiday Season

MTA eTix is the free mobile ticketing app that lets you purchase Metro-North Railroad tickets directly on your smartphone or mobile device. You can purchase One-Way, Round- Trip, Ten-Trip, Weekly, and Monthly tickets, along with Reduced-Fare, Child and Family Fare tickets MTA eTix accepts Visa, MasterCard, Discover, and American Express cards. As well as Apple Pay and MasterPass. Avoid long lines, have a happier holiday! See full details at http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo

Metro North's convenient Thanksgiving holiday service includes a special Thanksgiving Holiday Timetable covering Thursday, November 24 through Sunday, November 27. Be sure to pick one up in Grand Central or at our outlying stations. Or see our schedules page http://bit.ly/1arccwk or use the Train Time App http://bit.ly/1s3fjbQ . On Wednesday, November 23, take flight on one of our early getaway trains, which begin departing Grand Central at around 1 PM. See a regular timetable for details. Because of reduced ridership, some evening trains may be cancelled or combined. On Thanksgiving (Thursday, November 24), we will operate a modified weekend schedule with additional inbound trains for those of you heading to the Macy's Thanksgiving Holiday Parade. If you're leaving New York after the parade, you must have your ticket before boarding your train at Grand Central or Harlem-125th Street Station. We recommend you use MTA eTtix, the mobile ticketing app that enables you to purchase one way, round trip, ten trip, weekly and monthly passes on your smartphone or mobile device. See http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo On the Day after Thanksgiving (Friday, November 25), we will operate a Saturday schedule with additional trains inbound in the AM and outbound in the PM Finally, on Saturday, November 26 and Sunday, November 27 we will provide regular weekend schedules with additional Shoppers' Specials trains. See full service details at http://bit.ly/2g7vLZr

Metro North's convenient Thanksgiving holiday service includes a special Thanksgiving Holiday Timetable covering Thursday, November 24 through Sunday, November 27. Be sure to pick one up in Grand Central or at our outlying stations. Or see our schedules page http://bit.ly/1arccwk or use the Train Time App http://bit.ly/1s3fjbQ . On Wednesday, November 23, take flight on one of our early getaway trains, which begin departing Grand Central at around 1 PM. See a regular timetable for details. Because of reduced ridership, some evening trains may be cancelled or combined. On Thanksgiving (Thursday, November 24), we will operate a modified weekend schedule with additional inbound trains for those of you heading to the Macy's Thanksgiving Holiday Parade. If you're leaving New York after the parade, you must have your ticket before boarding your train at Grand Central or Harlem-125th Street Station. We recommend you use MTA eTtix, the mobile ticketing app that enables you to purchase one way, round trip, ten trip, weekly and monthly passes on your smartphone or mobile device. See http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo On the Day after Thanksgiving (Friday, November 25), we will operate a Saturday schedule with additional trains inbound in the AM and outbound in the PM Finally, on Saturday, November 26 and Sunday, November 27 we will provide regular weekend schedules with additional Shoppers' Specials trains. See full service details at http://bit.ly/2g7vLZr

REMINDER: QMT - Fast-track Sandy restoration work at the QMT The Manhattan-bound tube of the Queens-Midtown Tunnel will close an hour earlier on weeknights. Weeknight closures will be Monday - Thursday evenings from 9:30pm until 5:30am. Weekend tube closures will be Friday and Saturday evenings from 11:00pm - 8:00am, with some full weekend tube closures to be determined. Two-way traffic will run in the alternate tube. Motorists should expect delays and allow additional travel time.

REMINDER: HLC - Fast-track Sandy restoration work at the HLC The Brooklyn-bound tube of the Hugh L. Carey Tunnel will close an hour earlier on weeknights. Weeknight closures will be Monday-Friday evenings from 8:30 pm until 5:30am. Saturday evening closures remain the same, 11:00pm to 8:00am, with some full weekend tube closures to be determined. Two-way traffic will run in the alternate tube. Motorists should expect delays and allow additional travel time.

Reminder* Queens-Midtown Tunnel Weekend Ongoing Superstorm Sandy Repairs UPDATE

Queens-Midtown Tunnel weekend Sandy repair work from Friday night 11:00 PM through Sunday morning until 5:30 AM. During these times One tube will be closed and the remaining tube will operate in two-way traffic operations (one lane in each direction). Motorists should allow extra time and may wish to use an alternate route if possible.

Replacement of the South Bayles Avenue pedestrian overpass in Port Washington will begin Friday evening, November 4th and continue throughout the weekend. To accommodate the crane required for installation, the S. Bayles Ave. parking lot will be closed from 8PM Friday to 8PM Saturday. All cars must be removed from the lot by 8PM Friday. The parking lot will reopen Saturday evening. The new pedestrian overpass is expected to open for customer use on Tuesday, November 8th.

The Verrazano-Narrows Bridge will be closed to all vehicular traffic on Sunday, Nov. 6 between 7 a.m. and approximately 3 p.m. for the TSC New York City Marathon. Motorists traveling to Brooklyn or Staten Island via the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge must use alternate routes. In addition, on Saturday, Nov. 5, the upper level of the bridge will be closed to traffic in both directions beginning at 11 p.m. to allow for roadway preparation. Over-dimensional vehicles and vehicles containing hazardous materials will not be permitted to cross the bridge in either direction once that closure takes place. Motorist can call the Verrazano-Narrows Marathon Traffic Hotline at 718-692-5656 to hear information about the closures.
